titleStmt.title: Funny Story Donkey Harran

monogr.title: A Digital Dictionary of Shawi Arabic

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the SHAWI teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the SHAWI network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.
Private URIs using the dict prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a entry in the SHAWI glossary.
Private URIs using the rend prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a rendition element in VICAV rendition library.

spanGrp.span: He was rich, he was a sheikh, rich, chief of a tribe. He came to a place and was (accepted as) the guest of the place, as a guest.
It is said that they had a beautiful girl in the house, a beautiful girl. So he asked her father for her hand saying, “I want to have your daughter.”
The host, be it because of fear, be it because of shame, gave her to him in front of the tribes saying, “I have given her to you.”
He said to his daughter, “My daughter, without informing you I gave you to this man. I couldn’t disappoint him.
He is the chief of a tribe, a sheikh, he is rich and so I couldn’t disappoint him; the sheikh is old; his age is seventy or eighty.
She said, “Father, now that you have given me to him, I won't break your promise and I also will accept him out of respect for you.

But I have one condition.” He said, “What is your condition?” She said, “My condition is that I will set my bride price, I will fix the bride price myself. If you accept this condition, I also will accept him.”
He said, “Your bride price won’t be a problem, he is rich and will give you (what you want).” She said, “Allright!”
After some days have passed, the men of this sheikh came; those who were asking for her hand: ten, fifteen, perhaps twenty men, we don’t know how many.

They came saying, “Peace be upon you!” and (they responded), “And peace be upon you!” They came to the house, sat down, ate, drunk and after finishing they addressed the issue in order to ask for her hand saying, “Agha, we came to you because of the engagement.
Brother, what do you tell (us)? Load us up with our load in order that we can go back.” He said, “By God, I gave my daughter to the sheikh and I have not broken my word.

I have also informed my daughter and my daughter will not break my promise. She said, ‘Father, now that you have given me to him, I won’t break your word, but my condition is that I will set my bride price myself.’
Call for the girl and (ask) what she will set for her bride price! I will then also accept it.” They said, “Allright!”
They called the girl. She came and sat down behind a curtain. They asked her, “What do you want? How much do you want as your bride price?”

She said, “I want to have sixteen ewes. – You know what a nʕaǧe is? – Sixteen ewes.” “Okay!” “And twenty rams,” “Okay!” “And thirty foxes,” “Okay!” “And I want forty lions,” “Okay!” I want fifty young asses,” “Okay!” “And I want sixty donkeys.”
They began to look at each other, then they and said, “Hey, what did she do to us?” | She gave them a hint. | Yes.
They were thinking about it and said, “Allright, agha, we want to go back to the one who had asked for her.”
He made his group stand up and then they hit the road and went back to their place when one asked another one,
“Hey, we have sixteen ewes, the sheikh has them. And there are also twenty rams. We will find thirty foxes; we will hunt them, yes”.
But the forty lions are a problem. From where will we get these lions? From where? The young asses are available and so are the donkeys.” – This (story) is an allusion to the age of humans. – Yes.
They sat down to relax and aked themselves, “Who has a lion? I don’t know.” The sheikh had given them the command, he wants (her).
He (the sheikh) said, “Guys, what you are thinking about?” They said, “We are thinking about how we can collect all these things for our sheikh to bring them (to him).”
He said, “Guys, don’t think about it!” This woman, this girl, she just makes fun of us. And therefore don’t give thoughts to that. This is not an issue (for marriage).One said, “How is it then?”
He said, “The girl wanted from us sixteen ewes, sixteen. She wanted to say that her age is sixteen. She is sixteen years old.” “Yes.!”
And she wanted twenty rams meaning a ewe wants a ram of the age of twenty who can bear up against her and becomes her husband.”
They said, “Well, and what about the thirty foxes?” He said, “When a man reaches the age of thirty he becomes like a fox, apologies to the hearer!
His eyes are looking around watching every place.” “Well, and what about the forty lions?”
He said, “When a man reaches the age of forty he takes what is to be taken and gives what is to be given. At that age, a man is mature.” – “He is perfect.” – “Yes, perfect.”
“And the fifty young asses?” Apologies to the hearer that we again mention them.
He said, “When a man reaches the age of fifty he becomes like a young ass not knowing where to go.
And the sixty donkeys mean that when he has passed the age of sixty they take him by his headcollar and walk around with him and they take him wherever they want.

This girl does not want the sheikh, the old man. She doesn’t even accept him as a donkey. She does not want him. Go! Let us return so that we may get rid of this issue as she has freed herself (from me) by doing so.”
